intro: Asperula exasperata, commonly known as the alpine azalea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and rhododendrons, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Asperula exasperata is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
